title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.37 | 26-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: But actually Krishna is only reciprocal.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains that Krishna's dealings, even those that appear ordinary, are a display of his reciprocity with his devotees while maintaining his supreme position.

segments.key_quote: Due to ignorance only, the foolish mundane wranglers misunderstand the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: This segment focuses on Srila Prabhupada's explanation of the verse, highlighting the term 'abudhaha' (foolish) and describing 'mundane wranglers' who misunderstand and spread misinformation about God.

segments.key_quote: Now, if you carefully analyze every action of Sri Krishna, as described in the authentic scriptures, you will definitely find his divine potency working.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes Krishna's divine potency, using the examples of lifting Govardhan Hill and subduing Kaliya to illustrate his unlimited power and how every action of Krishna is full of this potency.

segments.key_quote: He may appear like an ordinary person, but his actions are full of bliss.
segments.summary: This segment contrasts Krishna's activities with ordinary activities, explaining that Krishna's actions are characterized by bliss, knowledge, and eternity, and are performed on the transcendental platform.

segments.key_quote: Plenty of evidence is there in the scriptures about Krishna's personality.
segments.summary: This segment provides scriptural evidence from the Bhagavad Gita and Upanishads to support the nature of Krishna's personality and explains how his potencies work according to his will, allowing him to engage in pleasure pastimes.

This segment describes the perfect plan of natural sequence in the material world, emphasizing how everything happens systematically according to karma and the laws of nature, while Krishna remains independent and engaged in his pleasure pastimes.

segments.key_quote: I appear by my internal potency.
segments.summary: This segment explains the difference between Krishna's internal and external potencies, emphasizing that Krishna descends by his internal potency and is unaffected by the material modes of nature (nirguna).

segments.key_quote: The correct understanding can only get from pure devotees.
segments.summary: This segment addresses the misunderstandings of mental speculators (mayavadis) regarding the impersonal Brahman feature and emphasizes that the correct understanding of Krishna can only be obtained from pure devotees through the parampara system.
